meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - I'm back with another review that'll make you groan (get it? like a hippos' signature sound?)! This time, I'm diving into LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2, a game that's all about building up the fun factor. And honestly, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned LEGO adventure?

Now, let me get this out of the way - the critics are saying some pretty standard stuff about this game. IGN says it's "constantly fun to play" in co-op mode (yaaas, squad goals!), while GameSpot notes that the gameplay is still basic but "reverential to its source material" ( Marvel fans, rejoice!). Gaming Age gives it a thumbs up for being more of the same familiar LEGO goodness we love.

But here's the thing - I don't care about all those fancy critic scores or quotes. What matters is what you'll actually have fun playing. And in that department, LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 delivers! The variety of settings, characters, and abilities keeps things fresh and exciting, even if it doesn't exactly break new ground.

I mean, sure, the combat can be a bit wonky at times (Cheat Code Central's got this one pegged), but when you're having this much fun, who cares? Vandal puts it best - "You won\u2019t find many new features here...but both the universe and the formula are quite good." That's what I'm talking about!

SpazioGames says it all: LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is an entertaining experience that'll keep you going until the very end. And honestly, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned LEGO adventure? It's like Destructoid puts it - "LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 still has the power to entertain...even if its core mechanics remain rooted firmly in the past." Yeah, let's just say this game is all about the nostalgia, and I'm HERE. FOR. IT!

So what are you waiting for? Grab your favorite LEGO minifigure (I mean, who doesn't have a favorite?) and get ready to build some serious fun!
